sentences.en: Aphrodite soon left him for Ares ( Mars ), the handsome god of war.
sentences.cn: 不久阿芙罗狄蒂离开他到漂亮的战神阿瑞斯 ( 即马尔斯 ) 那儿去了.

sentences.en: As of now we don't know much about Mars.
sentences.cn: 目前我们对火星还知之甚少.

sentences.en: He contended that there must be life on Mars.
sentences.cn: 他坚信火星上面一定有生物.

sentences.en: He stole a Mars bar from the school tuck shop.
sentences.cn: 他从学校小吃店偷了一条玛氏巧克力棒。

sentences.en: It will be a long time before any landing on Mars can be attempted.
sentences.cn: 试图在火星上着陆是一件遥远的事.

sentences.en: Living on Mars would be like living on a very high mountain.
sentences.cn: 在火星上生活就像住在一座非常高的山上.

sentences.en: Mars has an insubstantial atmosphere, consisting almost entirely of carbon dioxide.
sentences.cn: 火星的大气层极其稀薄，几乎全部由二氧化碳构成。

sentences.en: Mars is too faint and too low in the sky to be observable.
sentences.cn: 火星星光暗淡，位置低悬，难以看见。

sentences.en: The diameter of Mars is slightly over half that of the earth.
sentences.cn: 火星的直径比地球的半径稍大些.

sentences.en: the enormous volcanoes known to exist on Mars
sentences.cn: 已知在火星上存在的大量火山

sentences.en: The image of Mars is always accompanied by two little dots.
sentences.cn: 火星星像的近旁总有两个小点.

sentences.en: The living things on the earth could not subsist on Mars.
sentences.cn: 地球上的生物不可能在火星上生存.

sentences.en: The planet Mars will be visible to the naked eye all week.
sentences.cn: 整周都可以用肉眼观察到火星。

trans.tran_en: the small red  planet  that is fourth in order from the Sun and is nearest the Earth
the small red  planet  that is fourth in order from the Sun and is nearest the Earth
